output.formatted_report_T002:
ðŸ“Š Mahindra XUV 3XO Features Report

ðŸŽ¯ Executive Summary

This report provides a detailed overview of the Mahindra XUV 3XO, covering its key features and specifications. The XUV 3XO is a compact SUV offering a range of engine options, advanced safety features, modern technology, and a stylish design.

Engine Options

The Mahindra XUV 3XO offers multiple engine options to cater to different performance needs:

  • 1.2-litre Turbo MPFI Petrol: Producing 110 PS.
  • 1.2-litre TGDi Turbo Petrol: Delivering 130 PS and 230 Nm of torque.
  • 1.5-litre Diesel: Outputting 117 PS.

These engines are available with manual, AMT, and 6-speed torque converter options. The 1.2-litre turbo-petrol engine is the most powerful in its class, making 130PS/230Nm.

Safety Features

The XUV 3XO is equipped with a comprehensive suite of safety features, including:

  • Level 2 ADAS (Advanced Driver Assistance Systems) with features like forward collision warning and adaptive cruise control.
  • 6 Airbags
  • Anti-lock Braking System (ABS) with Electronic Brakeforce Distribution (EBD)
  • Electronic Stability Program (ESP)
  • Hill Start Assist

Technology

The XUV 3XO boasts a range of advanced technology features:

  • 10.25-inch Touchscreen Infotainment System
  • Over 60 Connected Car Features
  • Panoramic Sunroof (widest in the segment)
  • Real-Time Vehicle Tracking

Interior

The interior of the XUV 3XO is designed for comfort and convenience:

  • Soft touch material on dashboard and door pads.
  • Ventilated Seats
  • Automatic Climate Control
  • Adjustable Headrests
  • Rear AC Vents

Exterior

The Mahindra XUV 3XO features a refined and robust exterior design:

  • LED Projector Headlamps
  • LED Daytime Running Lights
  • Body Coloured Bumpers
  • Alloy Wheels (17-inch)

Dimensions

The dimensions of the Mahindra XUV 3XO are:

  • Length: 3990 mm
  • Width: 1821 mm
  • Height: 1647 mm
  • Wheelbase: 2600 mm
  • Boot Space: 364 Litres
  • Fuel Tank Capacity: 42 Litres
  • Turning Radius: 5.3 m

Mileage

The Mahindra XUV 3XO offers a mileage of 17.96 to 21.2 kmpl, depending on the engine and transmission type.

Variants

The XUV 3XO is available in multiple variants, including MX2, MX2 Pro, MX3, MX3 Pro, AX5, AX7, and AX7 L, with both petrol and diesel engine options.

Competitive Positioning

The Mahindra XUV 3XO competes with other compact SUVs in the market, such as Tata Nexon, Maruti Suzuki Brezza, Hyundai Venue, and Kia Sonet. It stands out with its powerful engine options, advanced safety features, and spacious interior.

Risk Factors and Uncertainties

Several factors could impact the success of the Mahindra XUV 3XO:

  • Market Competition: The compact SUV segment is highly competitive, with numerous established players.
  • Economic Conditions: Fluctuations in the economy and fuel prices could affect consumer demand.
  • Supply Chain Disruptions: Disruptions in the supply chain could impact production and delivery timelines.
  • Regulatory Changes: Changes in safety or emission regulations could require costly modifications.

The company needs to carefully manage these risks to ensure the long-term success of the XUV 3XO.

Hidden Signals and Meta Observations

The increasing demand for connected car features and advanced safety systems suggests a shift towards more technologically advanced vehicles in the compact SUV segment.

The availability of multiple engine options, including both petrol and diesel, indicates Mahindra's strategy to cater to a broad range of customer preferences.

Source Citations

  2. CarDekho - Mahindra XUV 3XO Specifications
  3. Autocar India - Mahindra XUV 3XO Specifications
  4. Jubilant Mahindra - XUV 3XO Specifications

Final Highlights and Recommendations

The Mahindra XUV 3XO is a compelling option in the compact SUV segment, offering a blend of performance, safety, technology, and style. Key highlights include its powerful engine options, Level 2 ADAS, and panoramic sunroof. To further enhance its market position, Mahindra should focus on:

  • Strengthening its brand image and customer loyalty.
  • Expanding its dealership network and service coverage.
  • Continuously innovating and updating its product offerings.

engine option. The entry-level XUV 3XO gets a 1.2-liter turbo MPFI petrol engine while the higher variants come with a 1.2-liter turbo direct injection petrol. Additionally, there is a 1.5-liter diesel engine on offer on the XUV 3XO as well. Mahindra XUV 3XO on road price starts from Rs 8.50 lakh going upto Rs 17.84 lakh for the top model diesel automatic variant. The more powerful petrol engine on offer on the XUV 3XO is the 1.2 TGDI version that churns out a healthy 130hp and 230Nm. It can be opted with either a six-speed manual or a six-speed automatic. Mahindra XUV 3XO mileage for the 1.2 TGDI petrol ranges from 20.1kpl for the manual and 18.2kpl for the automatic. This engine is available on the XUV 3XO AX5 L, the AX7 and the AX7 L variants. 5-star Bharat NCAP Safety Rating Compact SUV of the Year: Autocar Awards 2025 Mahindra XUV 3XO key specifications The Mahindra XUV 3XO offers a choice of three engines: 1.2L turbo petrol with 110 PS, 1.2L TGDi turbo petrol with 130 PS, and 1.5L diesel with 117 PS, paired with manual, AMT, and 6-speed torque converter options. It features a spacious 385-litre boot, a 10.25-inch touchscreen, and a panoramic sunroof which is the widest in the segment. With over 60 connected car features and Level 2 ADAS, it is a tech-loaded compact SUV. ðŸ“Š Mahindra XUV 3XO Features Report

ðŸŽ¯ Executive Summary

This report provides a detailed overview of the Mahindra XUV 3XO, covering its key features and specifications. The XUV 3XO is a compact SUV offering a range of engine options, advanced safety features, modern technology, and a stylish design.

Engine Options

The Mahindra XUV 3XO offers multiple engine options to cater to different performance needs:

  • 1.2-litre Turbo MPFI Petrol: Producing 110 PS.
  • 1.2-litre TGDi Turbo Petrol: Delivering 130 PS and 230 Nm of torque.
  • 1.5-litre Diesel: Outputting 117 PS.

These engines are available with manual, AMT, and 6-speed torque converter options. The 1.2-litre turbo-petrol engine is the most powerful in its class, making 130PS/230Nm.

Safety Features

The XUV 3XO is equipped with a comprehensive suite of safety features, including:

  • Level 2 ADAS (Advanced Driver Assistance Systems) with features like forward collision warning and adaptive cruise control.
  • 6 Airbags
  • Anti-lock Braking System (ABS) with Electronic Brakeforce Distribution (EBD)
  • Electronic Stability Program (ESP)
  • Hill Start Assist

Technology

The XUV 3XO boasts a range of advanced technology features:

  • 10.25-inch Touchscreen Infotainment System
  • Over 60 Connected Car Features
  • Panoramic Sunroof (widest in the segment)
  • Real-Time Vehicle Tracking

Interior

The interior of the XUV 3XO is designed for comfort and convenience:

  • Soft touch material on dashboard and door pads.
  • Ventilated Seats
  • Automatic Climate Control
  • Adjustable Headrests
  • Rear AC Vents

Exterior

The Mahindra XUV 3XO features a refined and robust exterior design:

  • LED Projector Headlamps
  • LED Daytime Running Lights
  • Body Coloured Bumpers
  • Alloy Wheels (17-inch)

Dimensions

The dimensions of the Mahindra XUV 3XO are:

  • Length: 3990 mm
  • Width: 1821 mm
  • Height: 1647 mm
  • Wheelbase: 2600 mm
  • Boot Space: 364 Litres
  • Fuel Tank Capacity: 42 Litres
  • Turning Radius: 5.3 m

Mileage

The Mahindra XUV 3XO offers a mileage of 17.96 to 21.2 kmpl, depending on the engine and transmission type.

Variants

The XUV 3XO is available in multiple variants, including MX2, MX2 Pro, MX3, MX3 Pro, AX5, AX7, and AX7 L, with both petrol and diesel engine options.

Competitive Positioning

The Mahindra XUV 3XO competes with other compact SUVs in the market, such as Tata Nexon, Maruti Suzuki Brezza, Hyundai Venue, and Kia Sonet. It stands out with its powerful engine options, advanced safety features, and spacious interior.

Risk Factors and Uncertainties

Several factors could impact the success of the Mahindra XUV 3XO:

  • Market Competition: The compact SUV segment is highly competitive, with numerous established players.
  • Economic Conditions: Fluctuations in the economy and fuel prices could affect consumer demand.
  • Supply Chain Disruptions: Disruptions in the supply chain could impact production and delivery timelines.
  • Regulatory Changes: Changes in safety or emission regulations could require costly modifications.

The company needs to carefully manage these risks to ensure the long-term success of the XUV 3XO.

Hidden Signals and Meta Observations

The increasing demand for connected car features and advanced safety systems suggests a shift towards more technologically advanced vehicles in the compact SUV segment.

The availability of multiple engine options, including both petrol and diesel, indicates Mahindra's strategy to cater to a broad range of customer preferences.

Source Citations

  1. Mahindra XUV 3XO Official Website
  2. CarDekho - Mahindra XUV 3XO Specifications
  3. Autocar India - Mahindra XUV 3XO Specifications
  4. Jubilant Mahindra - XUV 3XO Specifications

Final Highlights and Recommendations

The Mahindra XUV 3XO is a compelling option in the compact SUV segment, offering a blend of performance, safety, technology, and style. Key highlights include its powerful engine options, Level 2 ADAS, and panoramic sunroof. To further enhance its market position, Mahindra should focus on:

  • Strengthening its brand image and customer loyalty.
  • Expanding its dealership network and service coverage.
  • Continuously innovating and updating its product offerings.
